name: 朴維鎮
objective: The objective of this course is to introduce students to core ideas of probability and statistics, and also to provide an understanding on statistical concepts to include measurements of location and dispersion, probability, probability distributions, sampling, estimation, hypothesis testing, correlation analysis, and simple and multiple linear regression. Consequently, these skills will provide the student with a basis to conduct their own such analyzes and to evaluate critically others’ uses of statistics.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to statistics, data Summary, and presentation
Week 2 Probability, Bayesian theorem, correlation
Week 3 Random variables and probability distributions – Random variables, probability
Week 4 Random variables and probability distributions – Continuous random variables
Week 5 Random variables and probability distributions – Discrete random variables
Week 6 Decision making for a single sample – Estimation, hypothesis testing
Week 7 Decision making for a single sample – Inference on the mean of a population
Week 8 Quiz, independent Study
Week 9 Midterm exam (In-class, 1 Cheat Sheet, Calculator)
Week 10 Decision making for a single sample – Inference on the variance of a normal population
Week 11 Decision making for a single sample – Inference on a population proportion, goodness of fit test
Week 12 Decision making for two samples – Inference on the means of two populations (Part I)
Week 13 Decision making for two samples – Inference on the means of two populations (Part II)
Week 14 Decision making for two samples – Paired t-test, inference on the ratio of variances of two normal populations
Week 15 Decision making for two samples – Inference on two population proportions
Week 16 Building Empirical Models – Simple Linear Regression
Week 17 Quiz, independent Study
Week 18 Final exam
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam: 30 %
Final Exam: 30 %
Quiz: 35 %
Attendance: 5%
materials: Engineering Statistics (5th Ed., Wiley) by Montgomery, Runger, and Hubele (ISBN: 978-0-324-59433-1)
